Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately identify and represent two different habitats, one on land and one in water, in their drawing.
The student can include a wide variety of living things in each habitat, such as different types of trees, grasses, lizards, fish, and other animals.
The student can correctly show how different types of plants and animals are adapted to live in each habitat and their roles (e.g., fish in water, birds in trees).

The student can use their drawing to clearly illustrate patterns or differences in biodiversity between the two habitats, such as more aquatic plants in the water habitat and more insects and birds in the land habitat.
CANNOT: The student might infrequently omit or mislabel a minor detail, such as forgetting to label a specific type of plant or animal (e.g., labeling an aquatic plant as a land plant).
The student might inconsistently exhibit the exact relationship between certain species and their specific roles in the ecosystem (e.g., minor inaccuracies in representing food webs or hierarchies).
